LightningComponentBundle.description: This component allows the user to configure and display a datatable in a Flow screen.

propertyType.name: T
propertyType.label: Datatable Object API Name
propertyType.description: Select the API Name of the SObject to use in the Datatable

property.name: tableData
property.label: _ Datatable Record Collection
property.description: Record Collection variable containing the records to display in the datatable.

property.name: preSelectedRows
property.label: Pre-Selected Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable containing the records to show as pre-selected in the datatable.

property.name: outputEditedRows
property.label: Output Edited Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable to contain only the records that were edited in the datatable. - NOTE: To write these edits back to the Object, you will need to do a Record Update in the Flow.

property.name: outputEditedSerializedRows
property.label: Output Edited (Serialized) Rows
property.description: Record Collection variable to contain only the records that were edited in the datatable. - NOTE: To write these edits back to the Object, you will need to do a Record Update in the Flow.

property.name: outputSelectedRows
property.label: Output Selected Rows (Collection)
property.description: Record Collection variable to contain only the records that were selected in the datatable. - NOTE: These records may not contain all of the edited values.

property.name: outputSelectedRow
property.label: Output Selected Row (Object)
property.description: Record Object variable that contains the single record that was selected in the datatable. - NOTE: This is only provided when just a single record is selected.

property.name: outputRemovedRows
property.label: Output Removed Rows (Collection)
property.description: Record Collection variable to contain only the records that were removed from the datatable. - NOTE: These records will contain all saved edited values.

property.name: outputRemainingRows
property.label: Output Remaining Rows (Collection)
property.description: Record Collection variable to contain all the original records that were not removed from the datatable. - NOTE: These records will contain all saved edited values.

property.name: outputActionedRow
property.label: Output Actioned Row (Object)
property.description: Record Object variable that contains the single record that was processed by the most recent datatable row action. - NOTE: This record will contain all saved edited values.

property.name: isUserDefinedObject
property.label: _ (User Defined) Display User Defined Object?
property.description: Set to True if you are providing a User Defined object rather than a Salesforce SObject.

property.name: tableDataString
property.label: _ Datatable Record String (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable containing the records to display in the datatable.

property.name: preSelectedRowsString
property.label: Pre-Selected Rows (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable containing the records to show as pre-selected in the datatable.

property.name: serializedRecordData
property.label: _ (User Defined) Display Serialized Record?
property.description: String variable containing the records. Serialized record data.

property.name: outputSelectedRowsString
property.label: Output Selected Rows (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable to contain only the records that were selected in the datatable. -- NOTE: These records may not contain all of the edited values.

property.name: outputEditedRowsString
property.label: Output Edited Rows (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable to contain only the records that were edited in the datatable.

property.name: outputRemovedRowsString
property.label: Output Removed Rows (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable to contain only the records that were removed from the datatable.

property.name: outputRemainingRowsString
property.label: Output Remaining Rows (User Defined)
property.description: Object Collection string variable to contain all the original records that were not removed from the datatable.

property.name: outputActionedRowString
property.label: Output Actioned Row (User Defined)
property.description: Object string variable to contain only the record that was processed by the most recent datatable row action.

property.name: numberOfRowsSelected
property.label: Output Number of Selected Records
property.description: Total count of the number of selected records

property.name: numberOfRowsEdited
property.label: Output Number of Edited Records
property.description: Total count of the number of edited records

property.name: numberOfRowsRemoved
property.label: Output Number of Removed Records
property.description: Total count of the number of removed records

property.name: selectedRowKeyValue
property.label: Selected Row Key Field Value
property.description: The value of the keyField(Id) of the selected row

property.name: columnFields
property.label: _ Column Fields
property.description: REQUIRED: Comma separated list of field API Names to display in the datatable.

property.name: columnAlignments
property.label: - Column Alignments (Col#:alignment,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:Alignment Value (left,center,right). -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnEdits
property.label: - Column Edits (Col#:true,...) or All
property.description: 'All' or a Comma separated list of ColID:true or false -- NOTE: Some data types cannot be edited in a datable (lookup, picklist, location, encrypted, rich text, long text area) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnFilters
property.label: - Column Filters (Col#:true,...) or All
property.description: 'All' or a Comma separated list of ColID:true or false -- NOTE: Some data types cannot be filtered in a datable (location, encrypted) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnIcons
property.label: - Column Icons (Col#:icon,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:Icon Identifier -- EXAMPLE: 1:standard:account (Display the first column with the Account icon) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnLabels
property.label: - Column Labels (Col#:label,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:Label (These are only needed if you want a label that is different from the field's defined label) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnScales
property.label: - Column Scale Values (Col#:scale,...) (User Defined)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:Scale (The number of digits to display to the right of the decimal point in currency, number and percent fields (default = 0)) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnTypes
property.label: - Column Field Types (Col#:type,...) (User Defined)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:FieldType (boolean, currency, date, datetime, number, email, id, location, percent, phone, time, url, text(default)) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnWidths
property.label: - Column Widths (Col#:width,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:Width (in pixels). -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnWraps
property.label: - Column Wraps (Col#:true,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:true or false (Default:false) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnFlexes
property.label: - Column Flexes (Col#:true,...)
property.description: Comma separated list of ColID:true or false (Default:false) -- NOTE: ColIDs can be either the column number or the field API Name

property.name: columnCellAttribs
property.label: . Special: Column CellAttributes (Col#:{name:value,...};...) Use ; as separator
property.description: EXAMPLE: FancyField__c:{class: 'slds-theme_shade slds-theme_alert-texture', iconName: {fieldName: IconValue__c}, iconPosition: left}

property.name: columnOtherAttribs
property.label: . Special: Column Other Attributes (Col#:{name:value,...};...) Use ; as separator
property.description: EXAMPLE: Description:{wrapText: true, wrapTextMaxLines: 5}

property.name: columnTypeAttribs
property.label: . Special: Column TypeAttributes (Col#:{name:value,...};...) Use ; as separator
property.description: EXAMPLE: DateField__c:{year:'numeric', day:'2-digit', month:'long'}; NumberField__c:{minimumFractionDigits:4}

property.name: isConfigMode
property.label: Configuration Mode?
property.description: Display the Field API Names and the Column Widths in a box below the table. This parameter is designed to be used by the setup Flow.

property.name: hideCheckboxColumn
property.label: Hide Checkbox Column?
property.description: Set to True to hide the row selection column. -- NOTE: The checkbox column will always display when inline editing is enabled.

property.name: hideHeaderActions
property.label: Hide Column Header Actions?
property.description: Set to True to hide all column header actions including Sort, Clip Text, Wrap Text + Filter.

property.name: hideClearSelectionButton
property.label: Hide Clear Selection Button?
property.description: Set to True to hide the Clear Selection Button that would normally appear on a radio button selection table.

property.name: showRowNumbers
property.label: Show Row Numbers
property.description: Display a row number column as the first column in the table.

property.name: showRecordCount
property.label: Show Record Count in Header
property.description: Display the number of records in the table header. This will match what is shown in a List View header.

property.name: showSelectedCount
property.label: Show Selected Record Count in Header
property.description: Display the number of selected records in the table header.

property.name: keyField
property.label: Key Field
property.description: This is normally the Id field, but you can specify a different field if all field values are unique.

property.name: matchCaseOnFilters
property.label: Match Case on Column Filters?
property.description: Set to True is you want to force an exact match on case for column filter values.

property.name: maxNumberOfRows
property.label: Maximum Number of Records to Display
property.description: Enter a number here if you want to restrict how many rows will be displayed in the datatable.

property.name: isRequired
property.label: Required?
property.description: Require at least 1 row to be selected?

property.name: singleRowSelection
property.label: Single Row Selection (Radio Buttons)?
property.description: When set to True, Radio Buttons will be displayed and only a single row can be selected. The default (False) will display Checkboxes and allow multiple records to be selected.

property.name: suppressBottomBar
property.label: Suppress Cancel/Save Buttons during Edit Mode?
property.description: Cancel/Save buttons will appear by default at the very bottom of the table once a field is edited. When hiding these buttons, field updates will be applied as soon as the user Tabs out or selects a different field.

property.name: navigateNextOnSave
property.label: Navigate to Next Flow Element on Save?
property.description: When selecting Save after inline editing, immediately navigate to the next Flow element. This removes the need for the User to select the Next button after saving.

property.name: tableHeight
property.label: Table Height
property.description: CSS specification for the height of the datatable (Examples: 30rem, calc(50vh - 100px) If you leave this blank, the datatable will expand to display all records.)

property.name: tableBorder
property.label: Table Border
property.description: Display a border around the datatable.

property.name: isDisplayHeader
property.label: Display Table Header?
property.description: Display a header above the datatable.

property.name: tableIcon
property.label: Table Icon
property.description: (Optional) Icon to display on the Table Header. Example: standard:account

property.name: tableLabel
property.label: Table Label
property.description: (Optional) Label to display on the Table Header

property.name: not_suppressNameFieldLink
property.label: Show the Link on the Object's 'Name' Field
property.description: Show the default behavior of displaying the SObject's 'Name' field as a link to the record

property.name: suppressNameFieldLink
property.label: OBSOLETE as of v3.0.10
property.description: Suppress the default behavior of displaying the SObject's 'Name' field as a link to the record

property.name: isRemoveRowAction
property.description: Add a Row Action

property.name: removeLabel
property.label: Remove Row Action Label
property.description: This value will be used as the text that appears when hovering on the Remove Row Action Button (Default: Remove Row)

property.name: removeIcon
property.label: Remove Row Action Icon
property.description: This is the icon that will be used for the Remove Row Action Button (Default: utility:close)

property.name: removeColor
property.label: Remove Row Action Icon Color
property.description: This is the color (Red, Green or Black) for the icon that will be used for the Remove Row Action Button (Default: Red)

property.name: maxRemovedRows
property.label: Maximum # of rows that can be removed
property.description: Enter a number here if you want to restrict how many rows can be removed from the datatable (Default: 0 - no limit)

property.name: removeRowLeftOrRight
property.label: Row Action Column Location
property.description: Specify if the Row Action column should be on the Left or the Right (Default: Right)

property.name: rowActionType
property.label: Row Action Type
property.description: Select the type of row action. Current options are Standard and Remove Row. A Flow row action will be added in the future.

property.name: rowActionDisplay
property.label: Row Action Display Type
property.description: Select how you want the row action to appear. It can be a clickable Icon or a Button with a Label and an optional Icon

property.name: rowActionButtonLabel
property.label: Row Action Button Label
property.description: Select the label for the row action button.

property.name: rowActionButtonIcon
property.label: Row Action Button Icon
property.description: Select the icon for the row action button (optional).

property.name: rowActionButtonIconPosition
property.label: Row Action Button Icon Position
property.description: Specify if the Row Action Button Icon should be on the Left or the Right of the label (Default: Left)

property.name: rowActionButtonVariant
property.label: Row Action Button Variant
property.description: Select the Row Action Button Variant. This determines the visual appearance of the button.
